article.headline: Yale 70, Coast Carolina 65
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. (AP) -- Edwin Draughan scored 18 points, including four free throws in the final 39 seconds, to lift Yale to a 70-65 win over Coastal Carolina in the championship game of the Pepsi-Marist Classic Sunday. Dominick Martin scored 19 points and grabbed six rebounds for Yale (2-1). Draughan, the tournament's most valuable player, also had five rebounds, two assists and two steals in the win. Yale got off to a quick start, running to a 23-12 lead with 8:22 left in the first half before Coastal Carolina (1-1) climbed back to tie the game at 30-30 at halftime. Yale opened the second half with an 11-4 run, but Coastal Carolina pulled to within 49-48 on two free throws by Colin Stevens with 7:13 left in the game. The Bulldogs answered with a 14-7 run and held on for the victory. Brandon Newby led Coastal Carolina with 19 points. E.J. Gallup added 12 points. Yale shot 52.8 percent from the field and held Coastal Carolina to 41.4 percent shooting. Coastal Carolina hit 11 of 24 three-point attempts while Yale was just 1-for-12.
